verses.verse: The song <S%H7892><s%> of songs, <S%H7892><s%> which <S%H834><s%> is Solomon's. <S%H8010><s%>
Let him kiss <S%H5401><s%> me with the kisses <S%H5390><s%> of his mouth <S%H6310><s%>: for your love <S%H1730><s%> is better <S%H2896><s%> than wine <S%H3196><s%>.

Because of the smell <S%H7381><s%> of your good <S%H2896><s%> ointments <S%H8081><s%> your name <S%H8034><s%> is as ointment <S%H8081><s%> poured forth <S%H7324><s%>, therefore do the virgins <S%H5959><s%> love you <S%H157><s%>.

Draw <S%H4900><s%> me <S%H7323><s%>, we will run after <S%H310><s%> you <S%H4428><s%>: the king has brought <S%H935><s%> me into his chambers <S%H2315><s%>: we will be glad <S%H1523><s%> and rejoice <S%H8055><s%> in you <S%H2142><s%>, we will remember your love <S%H1730><s%> more than wine <S%H3196><s%>: the upright <S%H4339><s%> love you <S%H157><s%>.

I am black <S%H7838><s%>, but fitting <S%H5000><s%>, O you daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>, as the tents <S%H168><s%> of Kedar <S%H6938><s%>, as the curtains <S%H3407><s%> of Solomon <S%H8010><s%>.

Look <S%H7200><s%> not upon me <S%H7840><s%>, because I am black, because the sun <S%H8121><s%> has looked <S%H7805><s%> upon me <S%H517><s%>: my mother's sons <S%H1121><s%> were angry <S%H2787><s%> with me <S%H7760><s%>; they made me the keeper <S%H5201><s%> of the vineyards <S%H3754><s%>; but my own vineyard <S%H3754><s%> have I not kept <S%H5201><s%>.

Tell <S%H5046><s%> me <S%H5315><s%>, O you whom my soul loves <S%H157><s%>, where you feed <S%H7462><s%>, where <S%H349><s%> you make your flock to rest <S%H7257><s%> at noon <S%H6672><s%>: for <S%H4100><s%> why should I be as one that turns aside <S%H5844><s%> by the flocks <S%H5739><s%> of your companions <S%H2270><s%>?

If you know <S%H3045><s%> not <S%H3303><s%>, O you fairest among women <S%H802><s%>, go your way forth <S%H3318><s%> by the footsteps <S%H6119><s%> of the flock <S%H6629><s%>, and feed <S%H7462><s%> your kids <S%H1429><s%> beside the shepherds <S%H7462><s%>' tents <S%H4908><s%>.
I have compared <S%H1819><s%> you <S%H7474><s%>, O my love, to a company of horses <S%H5484><s%> in Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>'s chariots <S%H7393><s%>.
Your cheeks <S%H3895><s%> are fitting <S%H4998><s%> with rows <S%H8447><s%> of jewels <S%H6677><s%>, your neck with chains of gold <S%H2737><s%>.
We will make <S%H6213><s%> you borders <S%H8447><s%> of gold <S%H2091><s%> with studs <S%H5351><s%> of silver <S%H3701><s%>.
While the king <S%H4428><s%> sits at his table <S%H4524><s%>, my spikenard <S%H5373><s%> sends forth <S%H5414><s%> the smell there <S%H7381><s%>.
A bundle <S%H6872><s%> of myrrh <S%H4753><s%> is my wellbeloved <S%H1730><s%> unto me <S%H3885><s%>; he shall lie all night between my breasts <S%H7699><s%>.
My beloved <S%H1730><s%> is unto me as a cluster <S%H811><s%> of camphire <S%H3724><s%> in the vineyards <S%H3754><s%> of Enâ€“gedi <S%H5872><s%>.
Behold <S%H3303><s%>, you are fair, my love <S%H7474><s%>; behold <S%H3303><s%>, you are fair; you have doves <S%H3123><s%>' eyes <S%H5869><s%>.
Behold <S%H3303><s%>, you are fair, my beloved <S%H1730><s%>, Yes <S%H5273><s%>, pleasant: also our bed <S%H6210><s%> is green <S%H7488><s%>.
The beams <S%H6982><s%> of our house <S%H1004><s%> are cedar <S%H730><s%>, and our rafters <S%H7351><s%> of fir <S%H1266><s%>.
